series_description: Documents the tabulation of bid results, posting of awards and appeals to support the requirements of the Virginia Public Procurement Act.
retention_statement: Retain 3 years in division, then transfer to StateRecords Center for 2 years, then destroy in compliancewith No. 8 on schedule cover page. Total retention 5years.

series_title: Administration: Publications, Purchases and Supply Division Materials used to disseminate information about bids, procurement procedures and surplus property sales. Includes Virginia Business Opportunities (VBO) Bulletin, Exchange Newsletter and Surplus Showcase Newsletter.
retention_statement: Retain one copy permanently in agency, transfer one copy to . Send 20 copies to State Documents Receiving, Library of Virginia, perCode of Virginia, ยง2.1-467.2.

series_description: Documents daily routing of state mail to support delivery requirements for agencies. Includes charts and other information.
retention_statement: Retain 3 years in division, then transfer to StateRecords Center for 2 years, then destroy. Totalretention 5 years.

series_description: Documents applications and approvals for commercial use of the state seal. Refer to
retention_statement: Retain 5 years after expiration or rejection, then destroy.

series_title: Administration: Training Programs and Conferences Files
series_description: Documents training programs held by the division to educate state
retention_statement: Retain 5 years, then destroy.

series_title: Administration: Vendor Registration Database Contains data on registered vendors and commodity codes. Used to generate vendor registration reports.
retention_statement: Retain 5 years after expiration, then delete.

series_description: Documents subscribers to Virginia Business Opportunities, payments and solicitation distribution.
retention_statement: Retain 1 year in division, then transfer to State Records Center for 4 years, then destroy. Total retention 5 years.

series_description: Documents participation in class to become certified as a Virginia Contracting Officer. Includes class attendance, exams, answer sheets, score sheets, copies of certification and correspondence. Database duplicates certification information and is used for daily access. These paper files constitute the master records.
retention_statement: Retain 3 years in division after participant's attendance, then transfer to State Records Center for 2 years, then destroy. Total retention 5 years.

series_title: Division Director's Office: Administrative Appeals Files
series_description: Documents hearings held by Procurement Appeals Board to process appeals regarding vendor participation in procurement process. Files may include documentation from vendor, bidder, contractor, division, agency, board's decision in Findings of Fact, and transcript of hearing.
retention_statement: Retain 3 years in division after issuance of board's decision or completion of judicial review (as applicable), then transfer to State Records Center for 2 years; then destroy. Total retention 5 years.

series_title: Federal Surplus Property: Federal Property Eligibility Files
series_description: Documents customer applications required by the federal General
retention_statement: Retain 5 years after application, then destroy.

series_description: Documents vendor invoices and verification data used in coding, approving and paying bills.
retention_statement: Retain 5 years, then destroy.

series_description: Documents the issuance of merchandise to customers from the warehouse. Invoices are used as input documents for the automated inventory system.
retention_statement: Retain 5 years, then destroy.

series_title: Federal Surplus Property: Merchandise Transferred Files
series_description: Documents, through various forms, transactions of unit. Includes
retention_statement: Retain 5 years, then destroy.

series_description: Documents blanket agreements issued by division for use by state agencies, institutions and localities to purchase goods or services for a specific period of time at a special price.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years in division after contract is ended or completed, then transfer to State Records Center for 1 year; then destroy. Total retention 3 years.

series_description: Documents allegations of non-compliance with procurement matters.
retention_statement: Retain 3 years after close of complaint, then destroy.

series_title: Procurement: Purchase Orders Contracts that authorize division buyers to purchase goods or services
series_description: Includes contract changes and supporting documentation.
retention_statement: Retain 3 years in division, then transfer to State Records Center for 2 years; then destroy. Total retention 5 years.

series_description: Documents submissions by agencies to authorize division to procure goods and services. Includes requisition form DGS42, attachments for buyer reference, specifications, electronic tapes, correspondence, Invitation for Bid, Request for Proposal, bid tabulation results, change orders, vendor list and purchase order.
retention_statement: Retain 3 years in agency, then transfer to State Records Center for 2 years; then destroy. Total retention 5 years.

series_title: Procurement: Service Contracts Term agreements issued by division for use by state agencies, institutions and localities to purchase goods or services for a specific period of time at a special price.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years in division after contract is ended or completed, then transfer to State Records Center for 3 year; then destroy. Total retention 5 years.

series_description: Documents correspondence between unit and agencies regarding procurement issues.
retention_statement: Retain 5 years, then destroy.

series_title: Procurement Review: Correspondence Concerning Delegated Procurement Authority
series_description: Documents the results of unit's review of agencies' requests for increased procurement authority.
retention_statement: Retain 5 years or until superseded, whichever is longer, then destroy.

series_description: Documents changes to Agency Procurement and Surplus Property
retention_statement: Retain one copy permanently in agency. Send 20 copies to State Documents Receiving, Library of Virginia, perCode of Virginia, ยง2.1-467.2.

series_title: Procurement Review: Procurement Management Review Reports and Correspondence
series_description: Documents the results of unit's review of agencies' procurement practices and agencies' responses to corrective actions. Includes reports, correspondence, checklist, vouchers pulled, conference notes and follow-up plan.
retention_statement: Retain 10 years, then destroy.

series_description: Documents state procedures for purchasing goods and services in accordance with the Virginia Public Procurement Act. Includes Vendors Manual and Agency Procurement and Surplus Property Manual.
retention_statement: Retain one copy permanently in agency. Send 20 copies to State Documents Receiving, Library of Virginia, perCode of Virginia, ยง2.1-467.2.

series_description: Documents state agencies' requests for permission to dispose of property and responses by unit to these requests.
retention_statement: Retain 5 years after approval of disposition, then destroy.

series_title: State Surplus Property: Surplus Sales Proposals
series_description: Documents activities involved in auctioning of surplus property, including the transaction of bids and proposals. Includes letters, responses and other information.
retention_statement: Retain 5 years, then destroy.

series_description: Documents unit's function in supplying commodities to agencies.
retention_statement: Retain 5 years, then destroy.

series_title: Virginia Distribution Center: Purchase Requisitions and Bids
series_description: Documents process of procuring commodities requested by agencies
retention_statement: Retain 5 years after end of contract, then destroy.
